Summary: Agentforce NOW Workshop
Body: Agentforce NOW Workshop: March 20, 2025 / 10am - 12pm EST. Generative AI is revolutionizing app development, creating the biggest opportunity for developers and admins in decades. Join us for a free intensive virtual workshop to get hands-on with AI agents. Learn directly from Agentforce experts and get your AI and data questions answered. Leave with a better understanding of how to create and customize agents that seamlessly integrate data, AI, and human actions to support your employees and customers.  If you have any technical questions related to the hackathon/your submission, please join the Agentbuilder Slack Workspace! We have two channels: #virtual-agentforce-hackathon and #virtual-agentforce-hackathon-technical-support channel.  Reference: https://developer.salesforce.com/agentforce-workshop/getting-started/overview

Summary: Ensure your submission demonstrates the problem you're solving, the technology applied, and the impact.
Body: Ensure your submission demonstrates the problem you're solving, the technology applied, and the impact.

Summary: Your demo video should clearly showcase your use case, features, and technical approach.
Body: Your demo video should clearly showcase your use case, features, and technical approach.

Summary: Use screen recording tools like Quicktime or Camtasia. Avoid watermark tools. Record at 1080p resolution.
Body: Use screen recording tools like Quicktime or Camtasia. Avoid watermark tools. Record at 1080p resolution.

Summary: Avoid generative AI audio/video tools in your demo. Focus on accessibility and clean presentation.
Body: Avoid generative AI audio/video tools in your demo. Focus on accessibility and clean presentation.

Summary: Organize a strong team with defined roles: leader, admin, developer, marketer, designer, analyst.
Body: Organize a strong team with defined roles: leader, admin, developer, marketer, designer, analyst.

Summary: Find a unique, real-world use case. Avoid generic ones like 'order management'.
Body: Find a unique, real-world use case. Avoid generic ones like 'order management'.

Summary: Design a thoughtful data model, agent actions, and required data for the use case.
Body: Design a thoughtful data model, agent actions, and required data for the use case.

Summary: Distribute tasks, use demo data, and polish the UI/UX for submission.
Body: Distribute tasks, use demo data, and polish the UI/UX for submission.

Summary: Craft a compelling story. Use optional slides to highlight value, features, and outcomes.
Body: Craft a compelling story. Use optional slides to highlight value, features, and outcomes.

Summary: Agentforce system architecture includes Identity Mapping, Knowledge Base (RAG), AI Engine, Slack Bot, and Deployment module.
Body: Agentforce system architecture includes Identity Mapping, Knowledge Base (RAG), AI Engine, Slack Bot, and Deployment module.

Summary: Slack bot receives /ask command, retrieves user context via Devpost ID, queries the knowledge base, and sends result back to Slack.
Body: Slack bot receives /ask command, retrieves user context via Devpost ID, queries the knowledge base, and sends result back to Slack.

Summary: Knowledge base includes chunked markdown files stored in Data Cloud. Search Index is used by the Agentforce Retriever to find relevant data.
Body: Knowledge base includes chunked markdown files stored in Data Cloud. Search Index is used by the Agentforce Retriever to find relevant data.

Summary: Agentforce uses Prompt Template and GPT-4 to combine retrieved context with user question for accurate answers.
Body: Agentforce uses Prompt Template and GPT-4 to combine retrieved context with user question for accurate answers.

Summary: Data Retriever module connects to Data Cloud Search Index, retrieves context chunks and sends them into LLM prompt pipeline.
Body: Data Retriever module connects to Data Cloud Search Index, retrieves context chunks and sends them into LLM prompt pipeline.

Summary: Slack bot is built with Bolt SDK, hosted via AWS Lambda, and uses Firestore to store Devpost and Salesforce user mapping.
Body: Slack bot is built with Bolt SDK, hosted via AWS Lambda, and uses Firestore to store Devpost and Salesforce user mapping.

Summary: Personalization Rules can adjust answers based on Devpost ID, role, and prior queries to improve context relevance.
Body: Personalization Rules can adjust answers based on Devpost ID, role, and prior queries to improve context relevance.

Summary: Data Cloud Playground is created using Trailhead Coral Sample App with pre-enabled Data Cloud and Agentforce modules.
Body: Data Cloud Playground is created using Trailhead Coral Sample App with pre-enabled Data Cloud and Agentforce modules.

Summary: Craft a compelling story for your final submission.
Body: Craft a compelling story for your final submission.

Summary: Create a video that includes footage explaining your Project’s features and functionality through a comprehensive demonstration.
Body: Create a video that includes footage explaining your Project’s features and functionality through a comprehensive demonstration.

Summary: The video should include slides to introduce your use case and features, but slides are optional.
Body: The video should include slides to introduce your use case and features, but slides are optional.

Summary: Demo videos should be full screen and recorded in at least 1080p.
Body: Demo videos should be full screen and recorded in at least 1080p.

Summary: Use tools like QuickTime or Camtasia; avoid watermarked tools.
Body: Use tools like QuickTime or Camtasia; avoid watermarked tools.

Summary: Ensure accessibility: use high-contrast themes, large fonts, and no copyrighted material.
Body: Ensure accessibility: use high-contrast themes, large fonts, and no copyrighted material.

Summary: Avoid generative AI tools for video/audio and do not edit Salesforce characters like Einstein.
Body: Avoid generative AI tools for video/audio and do not edit Salesforce characters like Einstein.

Summary: 1. Organize: build a well-rounded, and collaborative team. Clearly define roles and align on complementary skill sets to maximize efficiency and creativity.
Body: 1. Organize: build a well-rounded, and collaborative team. Clearly define roles and align on complementary skill sets to maximize efficiency and creativity.

Summary: 1a. Teams may be comprised of up to 5 individuals. Consider roles & skill sets you may not have yourself including:
Body: 1a. Teams may be comprised of up to 5 individuals. Consider roles & skill sets you may not have yourself including:

Summary: 1a-i. Team leader drives the team's vision and coordination.
Body: 1a-i. Team leader drives the team's vision and coordination.

Summary: 1a-ii. Admin builds functionality using low-code tools.
Body: 1a-ii. Admin builds functionality using low-code tools.

Summary: 1a-iii. Developer pushes boundaries with custom components.
Body: 1a-iii. Developer pushes boundaries with custom components.

Summary: 1a-iv. Marketer crafts a compelling narrative and pitch.
Body: 1a-iv. Marketer crafts a compelling narrative and pitch.

Summary: 1a-v. Designer enhances usability and visual appeal.
Body: 1a-v. Designer enhances usability and visual appeal.

Summary: 1a-vi. Data analyst provides insights by interpreting and visualizing data.
Body: 1a-vi. Data analyst provides insights by interpreting and visualizing data.

Summary: 1a-vii. Content creator develops engaging content to support the pitch.
Body: 1a-vii. Content creator develops engaging content to support the pitch.

Summary: 2. Ideate: identify a unique, impactful, and innovative use case that effectively addresses the challenge.
Body: 2. Ideate: identify a unique, impactful, and innovative use case that effectively addresses the challenge.

Summary: 2a. A winning solution starts with a unique and compelling use case. Think outside of the box and find industry expertise.
Body: 2a. A winning solution starts with a unique and compelling use case. Think outside of the box and find industry expertise.

Summary: 2b. Avoid common & generic examples like:
Body: 2b. Avoid common & generic examples like: i. Order management - where is my order? ii. Case management - can you help me with my case?

Summary: 3. Design: develop a robust architecture and a thoughtful data model to ensure seamless, effective user experience.
Body: 3. Design: develop a robust architecture and a thoughtful data model to ensure seamless, effective user experience.

Summary: 3a-i. Define your data model using standard or custom objects.
Body: 3a-i. Define your data model using standard or custom objects.

Summary: 3a-ii. Think about your agent’s actions and use cases.
Body: 3a-ii. Think about your agent’s actions and use cases.

Summary: 3a-iii. Identify the necessary data.
Body: 3a-iii. Identify the necessary data.

Summary: 3a-iv. Define your UI/UX.
Body: 3a-iv. Define your UI/UX.

Summary: 4. Build: distribute tasks and work collaboratively to develop as much of your solution as possible while maintaining quality.
Body: 4. Build: distribute tasks and work collaboratively to develop as much of your solution as possible while maintaining quality.

Summary: 4a-i. Tools - use the toolkit to your advantage.
Body: 4a-i. Tools - use the toolkit to your advantage.

Summary: 4a-ii. Data - create demo data and ensure enough data is present.
Body: 4a-ii. Data - create demo data and ensure enough data is present.

Summary: 4a-iii. Agents - ensure Agentforce is central to the solution.
Body: 4a-iii. Agents - ensure Agentforce is central to the solution.

Summary: 4a-iv. UI/UX - polish page and record layouts.
Body: 4a-iv. UI/UX - polish page and record layouts.

Summary: 4a-v. App - build supporting components around your agent.
Body: 4a-v. App - build supporting components around your agent.

Summary: 5. Prepare: craft a compelling story for your final submission.
Body: 5. Prepare: craft a compelling story for your final submission.

Summary: 5a. Tell a story with your demo that showcases the true power of Agentforce.
Body: 5a. Tell a story with your demo that showcases the true power of Agentforce.

Summary: 5b. Use slides (optional) as a tool to tell the story of what you’ve built and the use case.
Body: 5b. Use slides (optional) as a tool to tell the story of what you’ve built and the use case.

Summary: 5c. Record a clean demo that showcases the app and agent that you’ve built.
Body: 5c. Record a clean demo that showcases the app and agent that you’ve built.

Summary: 5d. Tell a story with your script that highlights the technology and the use case.
Body: 5d. Tell a story with your script that highlights the technology and the use case.

ArticleTitle: Using Salesforce Knowledge Base in Agentforce with No RAG
Summary: Steps to configure your Agentforce agent using topic-based search and Knowledge Base content, without Retrieval-Augmented Generation.
Body:
Use Salesforce Knowledge Base in Agentforce when RAG is not available. You can build topics like 'Hackathon Rules Overview' and configure actions:
1. Search Knowledge Base
2. Generate Answer

Use a prompt like:
Based on the following knowledge, answer the user’s question.
Knowledge:
{{Knowledge Articles}}
Question:
{{user_question}}

Ensure all your markdown chunks are loaded into Salesforce Knowledge as individual articles, and linked via relevant topics (e.g., Rules, Tips, Slack Integration).
